thread.title_full: The Ashes 2015: England quick James Anderson ruled out of the rest of Edgbaston Test and fourth Test with side strain | The Advertiser

title: The Ashes 2015: Engl quick James Anderson ruled out of the rest of Edgbaston Test and fourth Test with side strain | The
text:
ENGLAND has suffered a major blow in its quest to regain the Ashes, with star fast bowler James Anderson ruled out of the fourth Test at Trent Bridge with a side strain.
Anderson suffered the injury while bowling on day two.
The 33-year-old will miss the remainder of the third Test at Edgbaston and his availability for the fifth Test at The Oval will be determined at a later date.
Anderson is Englandâ€™s all-time leading wicket-taker and his omission from the Trent Bridge Test is a major bonus for Australia. The right-hander has taken 53 wickets in eight Tests at the ground.
More to come.
Originally published as Anderson ruled out of fourth Ashes Test
